thread.title: SATURDAY FORECAST: Record warmth possible as temperatures soar above normal
thread.title_full: SATURDAY FORECAST: Record warmth possible as temperatures soar above normal

author: Bill Bellis
title: SATURDAY FORECAST: Record warmth possible as temperatures soar above normal
text:
SATURDAY FORECAST: Record warmth possible as temperatures soar above normal
LAS VEGAS (KSNV) â€” High pressure moving eastward this weekend is expected to bring some clouds, but temperatures will remain significantly above normal, ranging from eight to 12 degrees higher than usual for this time of year.
As Christmas week approaches, high pressure will continue to move east into the central U.S., leading to a pattern shift by midweek.
While uncertainties remain regarding the timing of next week's storm system, long-range models suggest a significant amount of moisture could impact the southwest.
BE THE FIRST TO COMMENT
Saturday's forecast predicts mostly sunny and warm conditions with a high near 67 degrees, while Saturday night will be partly cloudy and mild with a low near 50 degrees.
